latest news.eng_title: Worst teams in MLB history: Chicago White Sox nearing record for most losses
latest news.summary: The 2024 Chicago White Sox are on track to set an all-time major league record for the most losses in a single season, with a 35-115 record as of August 16. The team tied an American League record with a 21-game losing streak earlier in the year, leading to the firing of manager Pedro Grifol and several coaching staff members. General Manager Chris Getz acknowledged the team's disappointing performance, saying, 'As we all recognize, our team's performance this season has been disappointing on many levels.' The White Sox are chasing a dubious record, but will not surpass the 1899 Cleveland Spiders' all-time worst record of 20-134, a 'winning' percentage of.130.
latest news.title: Worst teams in MLB history: Chicago White Sox nearing record for most losses

latest news.eng_title: How many more losses do the Chicago White Sox need to match the modern-day record?
latest news.summary: The Chicago White Sox are close to matching the 1962 New York Mets' record for most losses in modern-day MLB history. The Sox need to go 8-4 in their final 12 games to avoid tying the 40-120 mark. They currently have 115 losses, a franchise record, and are tied for the fourth most losses in MLB's modern era. Interim manager Grady Sizemore said, 'Big momentum swing,' after a 2-0 loss to the Oakland Athletics, which extended their losing streak. The Sox have had three double-digit losing streaks and have snapped their current streak of 16 consecutive home losses. They also ended their 20-game series losing streak and broke a streak of not winning consecutive games since June 27-29. According to MLB Statcast, a 3-0 pitch that missed high was called a strike, leading to a strikeout and the Sox's best scoring chance fizzling.
latest news.title: How many more losses do the Chicago White Sox need to match the modern-day record?

latest news.eng_title: Oakland Athletics Eliminated From Playoffs on Chicago White Sox Walk-Off Home Run
latest news.summary: The Oakland Athletics have been mathematically eliminated from the 2024 MLB postseason, falling 13.5 games out of the third and final AL Wild Card spot with 13 games remaining. The Athletics' final season in Oakland will officially end on Sept. 29, with their final home game at the Oakland Coliseum scheduled for Sept. 26. The team's chances of making it to October were dashed when they dropped their showdown with the Chicago White Sox on Saturday, with Andrew Benintendi hitting a walk-off home run. The Athletics had a 2.5% chance to make the playoffs entering 2024, which dropped to 0.0% on June 11. The team will relocate to Las Vegas in 2028 after spending three seasons in Sacramento.
latest news.title: Oakland Athletics Eliminated From Playoffs on Chicago White Sox Walk-Off Home Run

latest news.eng_title: Column: Past, present and future meld together on the Chicago White Sox's road to infamy
latest news.summary: The Chicago White Sox are on the verge of setting the record for most losses in major-league history, with 120 losses. Despite this, fans are still attending games and showing their support. Sox fans are known for their ability to laugh off the team's struggles and continue to pay attention to the game. The team's attendance has been low, with only a few thousand fans showing up for games against the Guardians. However, this is not unique to the 2024 Sox season, as attendance has been low in the past when the team was not performing well. The team's chairman, Jerry Reinsdorf, has announced a decrease in season ticket prices for next year, citing the team's performance over the last two seasons. The article also touches on the team's history, including the old Comiskey Park, and the potential for a new ballpark in the South Loop. 'Sox gotta Sox,' a fan was heard saying, 'Step on the bag,' a fan shouted from the second deck, a request that was heard all around the park thanks to the lack of people.
latest news.title: Column: Past, present and future meld together on the Chicago White Sox's road to infamy

latest news.eng_title: Editorial: White Sox are on the cusp of historic MLB record. Will home supporters get to see it?
latest news.summary: The Chicago White Sox are on track to break the record for most losses in a season, with a 33-114 record as of September 13. To tie the 1962 New York Mets' record of 120 losses, the White Sox need to lose only six of their remaining 15 games. However, the article suggests that fans would prefer to see their team break the record at home, rather than on the road. To achieve this, the White Sox would need to go 5-4 in their remaining games, which is a challenging task for a team that has lost nearly four of every five games this year. If they succeed, it could make for a hot ticket at Guaranteed Rate Field on September 24, 25, or 26. As the article states, 'If justice is served, beleaguered South Side fans should be the ones to see their team make history.'
latest news.title: Editorial: White Sox are on the cusp of historic MLB record. Will home supporters get to see it?

latest news.eng_title: Nothing to write home about: Breaking down the Chicago White Sox's record 16-game skid at Guaranteed Rate Field
latest news.summary: The Chicago White Sox have suffered a record 16-game losing streak at Guaranteed Rate Field, the longest home losing streak in franchise history. The team has lost 28 of 29 games at home, with a home winning percentage of .236, the worst in the majors since the 1939 St. Louis Browns. Interim manager Grady Sizemore attributed the struggles to a 'tough stretch' where things 'just aren't going our way.' The team has been shut out 18 times this season, tied for the sixth-most in franchise history. Sizemore said, 'We're not getting the big play that we need when we need it.' The team has been swept in a series 23 times this season, and has a record 107 losses.
latest news.title: Nothing to write home about: Breaking down the Chicago White Sox's record 16-game skid at Guaranteed Rate Field

news knowledge.eng_title: White Sox Suffering: A Season to Forget
news knowledge.summary: The Chicago White Sox are experiencing one of the worst seasons in Major League Baseball history. After 139 games, they have already lost 108 and are heading towards their 109th loss of the 2024 season. A sequence like the one in the video below is not helping their cause. In the second inning of their game against the Baltimore Orioles, a defensive communication breakdown led to a collision between third baseman Miguel Vargas and outfielder Andrew Benintendi. As a result, Eloy Jimenez's high fly ball turned into a home run that scored all three runners. Due to the force of the contact, Vargas remained on the ground and needed the team's trainers to regain consciousness. He was eventually replaced by Brooks Baldwin.
news knowledge.title: À VOIR: une séquence qui résume parfaitement la saison des pauvres White Sox

news knowledge.eng_title: Miserable White Sox season hits new low with painful mishap, home run robbery
news knowledge.summary: The Chicago White Sox suffered their 103rd loss of the season in a 4-3 defeat to the Texas Rangers. The game was marked by two wild plays, including infielder Lenyn Sosa getting hit in the face with a ball and left fielder Travis Jankowski making a leaping catch to rob Andrew Vaughn of a walk-off home run. The 2024 season has been historically bad for the White Sox, with the team on pace to lose 124 games and break the record for most losses in a single MLB season, currently held by the 1962 Mets. As White Sox manager, said, 'It was a rough night for the White Sox on Wednesday.'
news knowledge.title: Miserable White Sox season hits new low with painful mishap, home run robbery

news knowledge.eng_title: White Sox cross disappointing threshold with 100th loss
news knowledge.summary: The Chicago White Sox have reached a disappointing milestone, becoming the first team in franchise history to lose 100 games in back-to-back seasons. They dropped to 31-100 overall with a 9-4 loss to the Tigers on August 25, 2024. The team's struggles have been ongoing, with a 1-26-1 record in series competition since May 15 and a 8-37 ledger within the AL Central. Despite the disappointing season, the clubhouse and roster have held together, with players showing resolve and a commitment to improvement. General manager Chris Getz acknowledged the need for a plan to improve the organization in all facets, saying 'We know there will be no shortcuts along the way. We are committed to doing what's right for us long term.'
news knowledge.title: White Sox cross disappointing threshold with 100th loss

news knowledge.eng_title: White Sox reach 100 losses for 6th time in franchise history: How many more will they lose?
news knowledge.summary: The 2024 Chicago White Sox have reached 100 losses for the sixth time in franchise history, with 31 games left to play in the season. This is the first time they have lost 100+ games in back-to-back seasons. The team is on track to become the losingest team in modern MLB history, a record currently held by the 1962 New York Mets, who lost 120 games in their first year. The White Sox have had several long losing streaks, including 14 straight games and 21 games, but also had some brief winning streaks, including a four-game sweep of the Tampa Bay Rays. They are the fastest team to clinch a losing season since MLB expanded in 1961, needing just 109 games to reach 82 losses.
news knowledge.title: White Sox reach 100 losses for 6th time in franchise history: How many more will they lose?

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 White Sox Are Literally Worst MLB Team of All Time After Historic Losing Streak
news knowledge.summary: The 2024 Chicago White Sox are on pace to lose 123 games, making them one of the worst teams in Major League Baseball history. Their .241 winning percentage is the 10th-worst in MLB history, but considering the team's recent performance, it's more relevant to compare them to the 1899 Cleveland Spiders, who lost 134 games. The White Sox's roster is worth 2.0 WAR, a mark reached by 97 different hitters and 52 different pitchers across MLB. They're threatening to become the first team in 43 years to score fewer than 3.1 runs per game. The team's manager, Pedro Grifol, seems like a 'dead man walking' after clashing with players. The White Sox's struggles are emblematic of a problem in MLB, where competitive balance has not improved, and teams like the Rockies and Marlins are also on pace to lose 100 games. The collective bargaining agreement has anti-tanking measures, but they have not been effective. The article suggests that a reverse luxury tax or tax penalties based on losses could be a solution to this problem.
news knowledge.title: 2024 White Sox Are Literally Worst MLB Team of All Time After Historic Losing Streak

news knowledge.eng_title: Editorial: The 2024 White Sox already are a team for the ages. There's still more to 'accomplish.'
news knowledge.summary: The 2024 Chicago White Sox are on track to set the all-time Major League Baseball record for losses in a season, with a current winning percentage of .235. They have already tied the American League record for most consecutive losses at 21. Manager Pedro Grifol and the team are struggling, and it's not just his fault. Owner Jerry Reinsdorf's decision to promote Chris Getz, the assistant general manager, to succeed the fired Kenny Williams and Rick Hahn, has been criticized. Reinsdorf said, 'Speed is of the essence,' but it seems that the team is going in the wrong direction. The team has 47 games left to play and is giving the term 'playing out the string' a bad name. Some fans are 'hate watching' the team, rooting for them to become the all-time worst in MLB's history.
news knowledge.title: Editorial: The 2024 White Sox already are a team for the ages. There's still more to 'accomplish.'

news knowledge.eng_title: Editorial: The 2024 White Sox already are a team for the ages. There's still more to ‘accomplish.'
news knowledge.summary: The 2024 Chicago White Sox are on track to set the all-time Major League Baseball record for losses in a season, with a current winning percentage of .235. They have already tied the American League record for most consecutive losses at 21. The team's manager, Pedro Grifol, has been criticized for his inability to turn the team around, and the front office has been questioned for their decision to promote from within rather than seeking outside help. Owner Jerry Reinsdorf's quote, 'Speed is of the essence,' has been ridiculed as the team's struggles continue. With 47 games left to play, the White Sox are giving the term 'playing out the string' a bad name, and some fans are 'hate watching' the team in the hopes of seeing them set the record for worst team in MLB history.
news knowledge.title: Editorial: The 2024 White Sox already are a team for the ages. There's still more to ‘accomplish.'

news knowledge.eng_title: White Sox reporter drops bombshell on team's manager, sums up 2024 season
news knowledge.summary: The Chicago White Sox have had a disastrous 2024 season, with a record of 27-84, the worst in Major League Baseball. The team has lost 17 games in a row and is 40.5 games behind in the American League Central and 34 games behind in the AL Wild Card race. According to ESPN's Jesse Rogers, manager Pedro Grifol has lost the trust of his players and it will be difficult for him to regain it. Rogers said, 'The short answer is yes, I just think there's been a leadership void since last year. You're really going to have to work hard to get that back.' With two consecutive sub-.500 finishes, it is likely that Grifol will be replaced by the end of the season.
news knowledge.title: White Sox reporter drops bombshell on team's manager, sums up 2024 season

news knowledge.eng_title: Chicago White Sox Lose 19th Game in a Row, Target One of MLB's Worst Records
news knowledge.summary: The Chicago White Sox have suffered their 19th consecutive loss, a 6-2 defeat to the Minnesota Twins, tying them for the seventh-longest losing streak in MLB's modern era. The team has not won since July 10 and faces significant challenges, including a trade deadline sell-off that has left them shorthanded. According to the numbers, the White Sox's current losing streak stands at 19 games, and they are on pace for a projected 38-124 record in 2024, the second-worst in modern MLB history. As White Sox management evaluates roster changes and strategies moving forward, it's clear that the team's predicament highlights deep-rooted issues within the organization, requiring significant changes in leadership and player development to restore competitiveness in the coming seasons.
news knowledge.title: Chicago White Sox Lose 19th Game in a Row, Target One of MLB's Worst Records

news knowledge.eng_title: Chicago White Sox Continue Historical Downtrend
news knowledge.summary: The Chicago White Sox's 2024 season is on a historical-bad pace, with their 17th-straight loss and fifth-consecutive series sweep. According to TSN Statscentre, this stretch is tied for the fifth-worst in American League history. The White Sox have scored over three runs just twice in their last 17 games, with a dismal .212 batting average in July. They have already broken their franchise record for consecutive losses, and will need to lose five more games to set the American League record for most consecutive losses. As they prepare for next season, the White Sox have already started retooling, trading several key players at the deadline. 'The 2024 team could end up the worst in MLB history as a result,' according to the article.
news knowledge.title: Chicago White Sox Continue Historical Downtrend
